title: Convoy
occurrences: The merchantmen we are to convoy are assembling outside Norwegian waters.
We'll steam across and pick them up and convoy them to Position X -
to get the convoy home, nothing must interfere with that.
Nor'nor'east, that'll never take us to the convoy.
Now look, Mr Mate, me and t'old Seaflower are not joining any convoy.
Steer a course for the convoy and follow on her quarter.
- Yes? - Convoy in sight, sir.
Right, Mr Cranford, signal the two lead destroyers to form up the convoy.
Form up the convoy.
This is a convoy, gentlemen, not a regatta!
Make a signal to all vessels in the convoy -
- Take up position ahead of convoy. - Aye-aye, sir.
On no account whatever must a naval vessel be diverted from the convoy.
leave convoy, proceed immediately latitude 52-30 north.
We shall attack as soon as the destroyer leaves the convoy.
And expose the merchantmen of this convoy to the danger of attack?
Damn, the destroyer's going back to the convoy.
Have the convoy made any reply to the SOS?
Any reply from the convoy yet?
Destroyers? They can't be from the convoy yet.
North Sea Patrol say they're bringing in the Seaflower to join the convoy.
Have them aboard right away. No need to stop the convoy.
that the Seaflower had joined the convoy without serious mishap.
I've had all the Seaflower passengers transferred to one of the convoy ships.
'against a British North Sea convoy.
'the convoy itself dispersed and thrown into confusion,
'alter course and take up positions covering flank of North Sea convoy.
'Alter course and take up positions covering flank of North Sea convoy.
'locate enemy battleship attempting raid on North Sea convoy,
'locate enemy battleship attempting raid on North Sea convoy.
'North Sea convoy due Position X two hours earlier,

So long as your ship's in my convoy, you're subject to my orders.
She's after the convoy.
Nay, you were right, we ought to have stuck to convoy, but...
We've got to get to the convoy at top speed, before she does.
- We can't be far from that convoy. - I've plotted the new course.
Approaching convoy rapidly.
We've got to hold her till the convoy's safely there.
Signal Commander Martin, take charge of the convoy, keep her on course.
I wouldnae be surprised if that's why they changed the time o' the convoy.
I've no time. I've got to get that convoy.
A very soft job this convoy.
